page.title: 07SCHOOL NAMES
page.content: Our school, Sheuchan Primary, was built in 1862 and was originally known as Leswalt Sheuchan Madras School. The Leswalt part is easily understood since the school lies in the Leswalt Parish, but it is thought that the Madras part was incorporated due to the receipt of a grant from Dr. Bell's Madras Trust for building the school. While it is doubtful if Madras aws ever officially part of the school name, there is no doubt in the mind of the general public that it is so, for many of the older inhabitants of the town still, to this day, refer to the school as The Sheuchan Madras.At this time Mr Pauling and Miss E Mc Lellan were appointed as headmaster and teacher, assisted by 4 pupil teachers, all in their teens. The school role for this 3-classroomed school was 240 children.
